I looked at the masakari source, I couldn't see how to add insecure for the keystone lookup.'}, {'account_id': 30810, 'date': '2019-10-04 22:19:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I believe failure in masakari test is rooted in masakari code:

https://github.com/openstack/masakari/blob/3a6f76b56212033e60b5b25913aca5d70eb7e2cc/masakari/compute/nova.py#L116

The keystone_session = keystoneauth1.session.Session(auth=auth) needs to pass a verify argument (not CONF.nova_api_insecure)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-06 09:48:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

So libkv as used by Docker does not allow slapping 'insecure' and be done with it :-)
It, however, supports this:
--cluster-store-opt kv.cacertfile=/path/to/ca.pem
so we could possibly modify docker_zun_config to include the proper path to the cert (making it CA makes it trusted). Remember docker obviously runs on the host directly.

I see etcd is modified only in this DNM - does reverting its 'security improvements' makes the Zun scenario jobs pass?

I just noticed etcd is completely insecure anyway as it has no auth enabled (it seemingly allows only connection level auth so TLS auth). We may be better off flagging it as insecure for the time being.

reported: https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1846938"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-23 12:48:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
DNM: Always enable TLS in CI

This ensures we test TLS in all our jobs, not just the TLS one, to get
better coverage.

Change-Id: I6c403fbf2b0799d30e73084d3792152bf5b6b2c2

Sean: This removes functionality that works for the LVM driver, and presumably some other drivers.  That definitely merits a release note...'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-22 13:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Sean: This removes functionality that works for the LVM driver, and
 > presumably some other drivers.  That definitely merits a release
 > note...

Well, also functionality that we said at the introduction of the feature was not allowed.

But again, this is a backport. We should get that added to the other branches too.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-22 13:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Rajat, there hasn't been any response from you on this. Can you get that added? This has been sitting since March.

We only have a few days left if we want to get this into an official Queens release before it switches to Extended Maintenance mode."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-10-22 14:58:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Due to timezone differences, I communicated with Rajat over email about this.

Me: Did you have a customer case or something that prompted you to backport that?  I'm trying to figure out whether we should get it into the final release from stable/queens.

Rajat: At that time, I was going through important bug fixes and started backporting them.
This wasnt a client demand, it's something I felt important to be backported to stable branches.
This may/may not be included, either is fine with me."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-10-22 16:20:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

OK, here's my opinion on this issue.  For some drivers, the scenario this bug fixes actually works.

I realize that the original spec for this feature was supposed to limit the feature in the way this patch does, but my concern is that the limitation rules out what looks to me like a useful feature.  (I can see someone extending a volume, then realizing that they need to revert to the last snapshot, which was taken before the extend.)  So I could see us doing a fix in master to allow it for those drivers that can support it, if someone were interested enough to follow up.

So now the problem is that if someone using this feature successfully in queens upgrades, they won't be able to use it anymore.  But if they did a fast-forward upgrade to where we had fine-tuned this fix, it would still work (or not, if we don't make a change).

Thus, I'm inclined to do nothing about this in Queens.  Since the backport wasn't prompted by actual user feedback, I'm afraid that the number of people who would benefit from it landing might be smaller than the number of people annoyed that we took it away.  So let's leave things the way they are."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-10-22 16:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree that this isn't critical and can be backported in the future if there is demand."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-10-23 12:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We agreed not to accept this backport.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-20 18:09:39.000000000', 'message': 'Forbidden to revert volume to a different size snapshot

As mentioned from original design:
"As we support extend volumes at present, we could meet the
case that snapshot is smaller than volume when reverting to
snapshot and it's obviously safe to revert in that case. But we
will still restrict to revert the volume which current volume size
is equal to snapshot, cause we don't support shrink volume yet
(that ability will be used in the generic method, if the driver
don't support revert to snapshot)."

So, we need add a size check before we revert a volume to a
snapshot. If the volume size is not equal to its latest
snapshot size, it will be raise a HTTPBadRequest(400).

Change-Id: Ib3cc95a10870822b9f597d66007699fb40908b61
Closes-bug: #1798503
(cherry picked from commit bfc27c9abaf366b6534ccb9e032cc26fd3ad3b65)
(cherry picked from commit 8ef380c8aef33615adcf435da6c29cb151bc3ee4)
'}]
commit_message:
Forbidden to revert volume to a different size snapshot

As mentioned from original design:
"As we support extend volumes at present, we could meet the
case that snapshot is smaller than volume when reverting to
snapshot and it's obviously safe to revert in that case. But we
will still restrict to revert the volume which current volume size
is equal to snapshot, cause we don't support shrink volume yet
(that ability will be used in the generic method, if the driver
don't support revert to snapshot)."

So, we need add a size check before we revert a volume to a
snapshot. If the volume size is not equal to its latest
snapshot size, it will be raise a HTTPBadRequest(400).

Change-Id: Ib3cc95a10870822b9f597d66007699fb40908b61
Closes-bug: #1798503
(cherry picked from commit bfc27c9abaf366b6534ccb9e032cc26fd3ad3b65)
(cherry picked from commit 8ef380c8aef33615adcf435da6c29cb151bc3ee4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-17 14:44:35.000000000', 'message': 'Less agressive cleanup of docker containers in post_upgrade_tasks

"system prune -a -f" deletes unused container images, as well as
containers which are stopped. This removes useful HA containers
*_init_bundle and *_restart_bundle, which makes debugging more
complex. This also removes tags whose image id are used by
pacemaker HA container.

Reduce the effect of cleanup by keeping stopped containers, which
in effect ensures that we also keep the tags used by HA containers.

Note: keep the aggressive cleanup for upgrade_tasks, because
they are always followed by deployed tasks, which recreate the
missing containers.

Note2: This doesn't apply for podman containers, whose cleanup
looks similar but is not as aggressive.

Change-Id: I936fb965687b961602e677bcca72f403121cbb0d
Closes-Bug: #1846368
'}]
commit_message:
Less agressive cleanup of docker containers in post_upgrade_tasks

"system prune -a -f" deletes unused container images, as well as
containers which are stopped. This removes useful HA containers
*_init_bundle and *_restart_bundle, which makes debugging more
complex. This also removes tags whose image id are used by
pacemaker HA container.

Reduce the effect of cleanup by keeping stopped containers, which
in effect ensures that we also keep the tags used by HA containers.

Note: keep the aggressive cleanup for upgrade_tasks, because
they are always followed by deployed tasks, which recreate the
missing containers.

Note2: This doesn't apply for podman containers, whose cleanup
looks similar but is not as aggressive.

Change-Id: I936fb965687b961602e677bcca72f403121cbb0d
Closes-Bug: #1846368

commit_message:
Don't throw exception when missing metrics

When querying data from datasource, it's possible to miss some data.
In this case if we throw an exception, Audit will failed because of
the exception. We should remove the exception and give the decision
to the strategy.

Change-Id: I1b0e6b78b3bba4df9ba16e093b3910aab1de922e
Closes-Bug: #1847434
can not cherry picke from master because of code refactoring
(cherry picked from commit 306224f70cfa3adcd2e17ea5d88eff7cd37ac2a2)

subject: Extend the dynamic executor type selector use
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 12:21:48.000000000', 'message': 'Extend the dynamic executor type selector use

Whenever it is possible use multi-process workers for more cases, like
when copying layers from a registry to a registry as well.

Given the added with Ie5ef4045b7e22c06551e886f9f9b6f22c8d4bd21
shared global view into already uploaded layers, we are no longer
limited with using only multi-threading workers for such cases.

That provides better tasks completion time as there will be less
single-threaded executions caused by IO operations and GIL.

Related-bug: #1844446

Change-Id: I9959547a55a69dbc5d1cb6677edc3ab49341881e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Extend the dynamic executor type selector use

Whenever it is possible use multi-process workers for more cases, like
when copying layers from a registry to a registry as well.

Given the added with Ie5ef4045b7e22c06551e886f9f9b6f22c8d4bd21
shared global view into already uploaded layers, we are no longer
limited with using only multi-threading workers for such cases.

That provides better tasks completion time as there will be less
single-threaded executions caused by IO operations and GIL.

Related-bug: #1844446

Change-Id: I9959547a55a69dbc5d1cb6677edc3ab49341881e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix session cert arguments

All calls to the deprecated ironic commands are failing because
unsupported cert arguments are being used to create the session
(cafile, certfile, keyfile)

This change switches to using the correct arguments. It is proposed
first on stable/stein because the deprecated ironic commands were
removed in Train.

Change-Id: If0730c0d9c1c3a700cbc6ae16b1c3752d0b681c4
Story: 2006748
Task: 37230
(cherry picked from commit 50f76012a843aa4bdd77a5fc0359f4d0cc10f1f8)

commit_message:
Set validation defaults to match undercloud default settings

In undercloud.conf, by default the dhcp ip address range is 20
(dhcp_start = 192.168.24.5, dhcp_end = 192.168.24.24).
This can be changed but is reasonable for POCs.  The validation
default should match this, otherwise there will be validation
failures when run on existing deployments that haven't
changed the default.

Change-Id: I601bb81540719f195915ab8298fd1f2c3fb65f39
(cherry picked from commit 96492aac15169d6ce7bad19192cdc800782fdb57)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 15:00:04.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

The test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_crash_finish_revert_migration test
needs to simulate a compute host crash at a certain point. It stops the
execution at a certain point by injecting a sleep then simulating a
compute restart. However the sleep is just 30 seconds which allows the
stopped function to return while other functional tests are running in
the same test worker process making those tests fail in a weird way.

One simple solution is to add a big enough sleep to the test that will
never return before the whole functional test execution. This patch
proposes a million seconds which is more than 277 hours. Similar to how
the other test in this test package works. This solution is hacky but
simple. A better solution would be to further enhance the capabilities
of the functional test env supporting nova-compute service crash / kill
+ restart.

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515
'}, {'created': '2019-10-09 15:11:54.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515
(cherry picked from commit f875c9d12fa03e1eb0d6ac0f3dd95f502ae1e6a1)

commit_message:
Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

The test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_crash_finish_revert_migration test
needs to simulate a compute host crash at a certain point. It stops the
execution at a certain point by injecting a sleep then simulating a
compute restart. However the sleep is just 30 seconds which allows the
stopped function to return while other functional tests are running in
the same test worker process making those tests fail in a weird way.

One simple solution is to add a big enough sleep to the test that will
never return before the whole functional test execution. This patch
proposes a million seconds which is more than 277 hours. Similar to how
the other test in this test package works. This solution is hacky but
simple. A better solution would be to further enhance the capabilities
of the functional test env supporting nova-compute service crash / kill
+ restart.

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515
(cherry picked from commit f875c9d12fa03e1eb0d6ac0f3dd95f502ae1e6a1)

commit_message:
Don't download image when it's already there

As image should have been already cached in CI [1], we shouldn't
download it again but just verify the checksum.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/master/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2#L226

Change-Id: Ib764c70e483513bec5bd97d4499e67beb4501826

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-09 10:55:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional test for resize crash compute restart revert

During review of change I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b
there was discussion about the RESIZE_MIGRATING crashed resize
cleanup on restart of the compute service and how it may or may
not work but is likely missing some things to cleanup like fields
set on the instance during prep_resize and resource allocations
in placement.

This adds a functional test to hit that code and make assertions
about what it does and does not cleanup after the crashed resize.

Related-Bug: #1836369

Change-Id: I107d842520c088b4859a3b36621ce6bd8e970475
(cherry picked from commit 8db712fe040b15f2b8bc5538338658d3aac246e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add functional test for resize crash compute restart revert

During review of change I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b
there was discussion about the RESIZE_MIGRATING crashed resize
cleanup on restart of the compute service and how it may or may
not work but is likely missing some things to cleanup like fields
set on the instance during prep_resize and resource allocations
in placement.

This adds a functional test to hit that code and make assertions
about what it does and does not cleanup after the crashed resize.

Related-Bug: #1836369

Change-Id: I107d842520c088b4859a3b36621ce6bd8e970475
(cherry picked from commit 8db712fe040b15f2b8bc5538338658d3aac246e3)

[{'created': '2019-10-21 14:00:58.000000000', 'message': 'Extract cephx keys from vault encrypted files

Cephx keys are not picked up by "local_action: shell cat [...]"
when using ansible-vault encrypted keyrings.
This commit changes the logic to use the file lookup plugin and
extracts the key using jinja2 regex filters. The raw keys are then
set as ansible facts.

Change-Id: Iacb1e42307c4de6a7a379e8cf279e073995fd5d3

when using ansible-vault encrypted keyrings.
This commit changes the logic to use the file lookup plugin and
extracts the key using jinja2 regex filters. The raw keys are then

Closes-Bug: 1849127

Change-Id: Iacb1e42307c4de6a7a379e8cf279e073995fd5d3
'}]
commit_message:
Extract cephx keys from vault encrypted files

Cephx keys are not picked up by "local_action: shell cat [...]"
when using ansible-vault encrypted keyrings.
This commit changes the logic to use the file lookup plugin and
extracts the key using jinja2 regex filters. The raw keys are then
set as ansible facts.

Closes-Bug: 1849127

Change-Id: Iacb1e42307c4de6a7a379e8cf279e073995fd5d3

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility for barbican

Barbican refers to python3 but uwsgi refers to python2. This change
fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I508bb082a319955b3e008235e158eaa07a1e8a74
Closes-Bug: #1849128
(cherry picked from commit 823e45a6c909437a6530c9f34f9e4f5cce8ab79c)

subject: CI: Increase job run attempts to 5
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-10-21 15:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-10-21 17:21:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-10-23 09:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit ff815baf44b0ed4348b4c9c63eef704e05e10c37'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-21 14:49:05.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Increase job run attempts to 5

Attempts affect pre failures.  This means we can increase stability of
jobs by rejecting nodes that fail pre without failing runs at the same
time (unless we are really unlucky and hit b0rken nodes 5 times in a
row).

This change is adapted from I17b7f878c742fa8db66f738526855a02ab9f1905 in
kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: Ied5d2cb8ffa47b90833ee3cf241797601906f9b2
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Increase job run attempts to 5

Attempts affect pre failures.  This means we can increase stability of
jobs by rejecting nodes that fail pre without failing runs at the same
time (unless we are really unlucky and hit b0rken nodes 5 times in a
row).

This change is adapted from I17b7f878c742fa8db66f738526855a02ab9f1905 in
kolla-ansible.

Change-Id: Ied5d2cb8ffa47b90833ee3cf241797601906f9b2

commit_message:
Support Shibboleth service provider for keystone to keystone.

Use keystone as identity provider and Shibboleth as service
provider in login multi-cloud.

Shibboleth only support libcurl3 but mellon and openid
depend libcurl4. So, need to work around to install both
libcurl3 and libcurl4 on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ibd5666a2f8f8d0cb2bee4c3758dd0d228f97549c

commit_message:
ovn_northbound: make all list commands ReadOnlyCommand

Some ListCommands were BaseCommand instead of ReadOnlyCommand
This change fixes that. Namely, making these commands
consistent with the other list commands:

- LsListCommand
- _AclListHelper
- QoSListCommand
- LspListCommand

Change-Id: I89f641dc42f1b6cec717ff1d24e05248536daf62

commit_message:
Allow IPv6 health network in devstack

This allows the Octavia devstack plugin to use IPv6 for the service
endpoint as well as for the lb-mgmt-net.

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I87917440565ea953ec0d762a7e219d912c56c418

commit_message:
Do not set log format when 'no log' is set

Re-factored code to not insert a log-format line in haproxy
config when 'no log' is set in the template. Adjusted tests
as necessary.

Story: 2006181
Task: 35706

Change-Id: I8a0cdf7ee912d39d9ac24244728094a1d1e15c63

commit_message:
Revert "Log CellTimeout traceback in scatter_gather_cells"

This reverts commit 0436a95f37df086ddc99017376cb9a312e40517a.

This was meant to get us more debug details when hitting the
failure but the results are not helpful [1] so revert this
and the fix for the resulting regression [2].

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/782116/
[2] I7f9edc9a4b4930f4dce98df271888fa8082a1701

Change-Id: Iab8029f081a654278ea7dbbec79a766aea6764ae
Related-Bug: #1844929

commit_message:
Fix OS requirments

As far as we don't support neither Ubuntu Xenial, nor openSUSE 42,
we need to update our docs regarding OS supported versions.

Change-Id: I7da7db0c2ad6d606f6505f91d02c5d8c69923114

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 14:22:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix aes-xts key length in Horizon Admin Guide / Manage Volumes

When using aes-xts-plain64, a 512 bit key produces an error as this
is not a supported barbican key length for aes-xts-plain64. This patch
updates the horzion admin doc to remove the reference of a 512 bit key.

Change-Id: Ie36e05a1e59eb88b779c9f3249a714c20b5f5fe0
Closes-Bug: #1708505
Closes-Bug: #1849196
(cherry picked from commit 85a1dddf126691921924edcecaee5c054c7df6c2)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix aes-xts key length in Horizon Admin Guide / Manage Volumes

When using aes-xts-plain64, a 512 bit key produces an error as this
is not a supported barbican key length for aes-xts-plain64. This patch
updates the horzion admin doc to remove the reference of a 512 bit key.

Change-Id: Ie36e05a1e59eb88b779c9f3249a714c20b5f5fe0
Closes-Bug: #1708505
Closes-Bug: #1849196
(cherry picked from commit 85a1dddf126691921924edcecaee5c054c7df6c2)

[{'account_id': 14807, 'date': '2019-08-11 12:13:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-11 14:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/675776/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 15m 46s'}, {'account_id': 14807, 'date': '2019-08-12 07:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The original commit broke MacVtap in libvirt 4.5'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:20:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm all for reverting this if it's broken something, but we need context in the commit message, perhaps some references to libvirt bugs (so we can update the TODO again), and a nova bug."}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:35:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm all for reverting this if it's broken something, but we need
 > context in the commit message, perhaps some references to libvirt
 > bugs (so we can update the TODO again), and a nova bug.

I think it related to this https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/b91a33638476cf57d910b6056a8fc11921edd029#diff-28bc83a0c3470bba712dfa6824a79c9d. So they change from setting the admin mac to the effective mac. The problem is that the sriov-nic agent relay on the admin mac to send rpc to the neutron server. If the mac and the pci slot don't much it ignores it and the VM stuck in spawn until timeout"}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2019-08-12 09:53:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I'm all for reverting this if it's broken something, but we need
 > > context in the commit message, perhaps some references to libvirt
 > > bugs (so we can update the TODO again), and a nova bug.
 > 
 > I think it related to this https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/b91a33638476cf57d910b6056a8fc11921edd029#diff-28bc83a0c3470bba712dfa6824a79c9d.
 > So they change from setting the admin mac to the effective mac. The
 > problem is that the sriov-nic agent relay on the admin mac to send
 > rpc to the neutron server. If the mac and the pci slot don't much
 > it ignores it and the VM stuck in spawn until timeout

Maybe we should fix the sriov nic agent to read the effect mac if possible. I will try it out."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-12 20:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the sriov nic agent should look at only the pci adress.
the mac is not part of the set of info that it nova provides that it should rely on.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-12 20:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12171, 'date': '2019-08-12 20:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> the sriov nic agent should look at only the pci adress.
 > the mac is not part of the set of info that it nova provides that
 > it should rely on.

Yep, I agree the design of it was bad to rely on mac. I am not sure how easy is to change it.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-12 21:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-35068 : FAILURE in 2h 44m 38s'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 14:49:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Removing mac address dependency from neutron sriov agent is not that easy because in order to fetch port information from the server it relies on the mac address as a unique identifier for the port.[1]

using pci_address and host_id, while possible will require the neutron server to be aware of the content of the binding:profile blob (which i don't think we want). while there are other alternatives they will require database/model/rpc changes.

anyway, i uploaded a (WIP) patch that uses the effective mac of a macvtap netdev instead of relying on the administrative mac on the PF.[2]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/2a97ffe892f7b3c1557ec7cf8888b1e044700b10/neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py#L77
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/2a97ffe892f7b3c1557ec7cf8888b1e044700b10/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L2234
[2]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676713"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-15 14:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

the netuon servr is ment to use the pci_slot info in the profile to corralate the vf to the neutron port so yes we do want it to be aware of that. and we do not want it to depend on the mac as that is not guarenteed to be unique in a give vm.

it is required to be unique on any given netwrok but neutron allows the same mac to be used on multiple netwroks and and we allow two ports with the same mac to be attached to the same vm.

ignoring that aspect for a moment with trusted vfs the guest can in theory change the mac adress too although im not sure if that is only support for direct mode sriov or if it also works with macvtap. im doing sriov testing at teh mome so i might try that later but i was not planning on testing trusted vfs today.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 15:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

"the netuon servr is ment to use the pci_slot info in the profile to corralate the vf to the neutron port so yes we do want it to be aware of that."

Is that your opinion ? as i did not find an evidence in the code for it.

Taking this approach means the db query will take longer as we will require to get all ports bound for the host, then iterate to find the port with the correct PCI in binding profile.

also lets not forget we will need to filter out any binding profile containing "switchdev" capabilities as these are utilized by a different agent.

I agree that it's best to avoid relying on mac address since macs can potentially be duplicate if ports are on different networks.

But if we find ourselves going through a JSON blob to find a PCI device in neutron server, we may have taken a wrong turn along the way.

Having said that, i fully agree that mac *should* not be used to uniquely identify the port (in case my last comment didn't express that). Im saying the alternatives are not that pretty.

having a place to store a UID of a port/VM by the agent similarly to openvswitch would have came in handy here... :)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-15 15:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

also im not sure how will macvtap behave in case of same mac on different vlans

since vlan is set on VF index and mac is applied on the macvtap net device (today the lower and upper device are set to the same value)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-08-15 16:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

no its based on a number of factors
on the definito of the port binding profile is 
"# The profile will be a dictionary that enables the application running
# on the specific host to pass and receive vif port specific information to
# the plugin."

so the entire reason teh port profile exist is for nova to pass info to the neutron ml2 plugin for the drives to use.

https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/104627a9336c2cff6808dc0024c43c6b0a7a723c/neutron_lib/api/definitions/portbindings.py#L31-L34



the nova spec that added neutron sriov support stated the following

"Note that Nova network will not be enhanced to support SR-IOV. However, Nova modules that are responsible for interacting with neutron need to be enhanced.

Refer to [BINDPRF], [VIFDETA], [VNICTYP] that has added the functionalities required to support SR-IOV ports in neutron. Accordingly, nova neutronv2 will be enhanced to work with them in support of SR-IOV ports. Particularly:

    When nova processes the nic options, physical network names will be retrieved from neutron. This needs to be done by using neutron provider extension with admin access. As a result, additional neutron calls will be made to retrieve the physical network name.

    When nova updates neutron ports, binding:profile needs to be populated with pci information that includes pci_vendor_info, pci_slot, physical_network.

    After nova successfully updates the neutron ports, it retrieves the ports information from neutron that are used to populate VIF objects. New properties will be added in the VIF class in support of binding:profile, binding:vif_details and binding:vnic_type.
"

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/juno/implemented/pci-passthrough-sriov.html#nova-neutronv2-and-vif

from the very begining the binding:profile was the mechanisum by which we state the info about the vf to neutron'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-18 10:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Removing the dependency of MAC address from SR-IOV agent can be regarded as an Enhancement and i fear will take time to have a consensus on the details and might not be merged on time for Train release.

To solve the immediate issue of VM not booting with a macvtap port we can either:

1. Accept this revert. Then remove MAC address dependency in neutron later down the road.
2. Introduce a fix in Neutron to refer to the correct MAC address for macvtap ports[1]. Then remove MAC address dependency in neutron later down the road.

*The "later down the road part" is something that ATM i have no bandwidth to work on unfortunately.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676713'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-22 14:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Have created an issue in neutron to remove mac address dependency from SR-IOV agent:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1841067'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2019-08-22 14:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-08-22 17:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

the name of the node deve element changes because the mac changes when we asign it to the vm 

so we are eiter using the new mac but livirt is still using the old mac or we are using the old mac and libvirt i susing the new one.

i have not tested this patch yet. ill try to do it todya but

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 22:14:19.000000000', 'message': "rt: soften warning case in _remove_deleted_instances_allocations

During an instance_claim during initial server create or unshelve,
the instance.host/node values will be set before the resource
tracker has the instance in the tracked_instances dict. If
_remove_deleted_instances_allocations is called with the instance
before it's being tracked, a warning like this is logged:

  Jul 31 13:12:57.455904 ubuntu-bionic-rax-iad-0009534722
  nova-compute[31951]: WARNING nova.compute.resource_tracker
  [None req-d6f2ae97-d8f7-46f6-8974-b42aeb58302d None None]
  Instance 227c23cd-aeb2-4b5a-b001-21bd920a5e77 is not being actively
  managed by this compute host but has allocations referencing this
  compute host: {u'resources': {u'MEMORY_MB': 64, u'VCPU': 1,
  u'DISK_GB': 1}}. Skipping heal of allocation because we do not know
  what to do.

This shows up quite frequently in CI runs (see the bug report for
a logstash query) which means it should not be a warning.

This change checks the instance task_state and if set then we only
log a debug message rather than the warning since we can assume we
are racing and the task will correct itself upon completion.

Change-Id: I6db8bea6761b68c39e6332d4698d1f8312863758
Closes-Bug: #1838541
(cherry picked from commit ad4ef5af8bf7dc34caef21b0062ef9cc504bc216)
"}]
commit_message:
rt: soften warning case in _remove_deleted_instances_allocations

During an instance_claim during initial server create or unshelve,
the instance.host/node values will be set before the resource
tracker has the instance in the tracked_instances dict. If
_remove_deleted_instances_allocations is called with the instance
before it's being tracked, a warning like this is logged:

  Jul 31 13:12:57.455904 ubuntu-bionic-rax-iad-0009534722
  nova-compute[31951]: WARNING nova.compute.resource_tracker
  [None req-d6f2ae97-d8f7-46f6-8974-b42aeb58302d None None]
  Instance 227c23cd-aeb2-4b5a-b001-21bd920a5e77 is not being actively
  managed by this compute host but has allocations referencing this
  compute host: {u'resources': {u'MEMORY_MB': 64, u'VCPU': 1,
  u'DISK_GB': 1}}. Skipping heal of allocation because we do not know
  what to do.

This shows up quite frequently in CI runs (see the bug report for
a logstash query) which means it should not be a warning.

This change checks the instance task_state and if set then we only
log a debug message rather than the warning since we can assume we
are racing and the task will correct itself upon completion.

Change-Id: I6db8bea6761b68c39e6332d4698d1f8312863758
Closes-Bug: #1838541
(cherry picked from commit ad4ef5af8bf7dc34caef21b0062ef9cc504bc216)

commit_message:
Remove compute compat checks for aborting queued live migrations

These were added in Rocky [1] and can now been removed, since we don't
need to support anything from before Train in Ussuri.

[1] I4636a8d270ce01c1831bc951c4497ad472bc9aa8

Change-Id: Ib01ebeff0647f6e27714856f3a36c3896eeab27f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add volume type name and description check when update volume type

when we need to update volume type, currently we can set volume type
name to empty string, in API layer we need to check type name,it can not
be empty string and cannot be greater than 255, as same volume
description cannot be greater than 255, we also need to check.

Change-Id: I4b78f3834848db669a86d0f7820ca5da409cf354
Closes-Bug:#1847171

[{'created': '2019-10-14 21:08:46.000000000', 'message': "Pure: Ensure generated volume name does not exceed 63 characters

Some OpenStack deployments create a volume.name, that when linked with
Pure's naming standard, the resulting volume name length exceeds the
63 character limit for Pure volumes.

This truncates the left (least unique) section of the volume name,
excluding the volume_name_template piece, to ensure the volume
name length never causes an error on creation.

Change-Id: I9398bb163089c9b6695299203a42423f39272581
(cherry picked from commit cd6643d79ae6aaa7c6d928650f97101213118f9c)
"}]
commit_message:
Pure: Ensure generated volume name does not exceed 63 characters

Some OpenStack deployments create a volume.name, that when linked with
Pure's naming standard, the resulting volume name length exceeds the
63 character limit for Pure volumes.

This truncates the left (least unique) section of the volume name,
excluding the volume_name_template piece, to ensure the volume
name length never causes an error on creation.

Change-Id: I9398bb163089c9b6695299203a42423f39272581
(cherry picked from commit cd6643d79ae6aaa7c6d928650f97101213118f9c)

[{'created': '2019-10-14 21:08:26.000000000', 'message': "Pure: Ensure generated volume name does not exceed 63 characters

Some OpenStack deployments create a volume.name, that when linked with
Pure's naming standard, the resulting volume name length exceeds the
63 character limit for Pure volumes.

This truncates the left (least unique) section of the volume name,
excluding the volume_name_template piece, to ensure the volume
name length never causes an error on creation.

Change-Id: I9398bb163089c9b6695299203a42423f39272581
(cherry picked from commit cd6643d79ae6aaa7c6d928650f97101213118f9c)
"}]
commit_message:
Pure: Ensure generated volume name does not exceed 63 characters

Some OpenStack deployments create a volume.name, that when linked with
Pure's naming standard, the resulting volume name length exceeds the
63 character limit for Pure volumes.

This truncates the left (least unique) section of the volume name,
excluding the volume_name_template piece, to ensure the volume
name length never causes an error on creation.

Change-Id: I9398bb163089c9b6695299203a42423f39272581
(cherry picked from commit cd6643d79ae6aaa7c6d928650f97101213118f9c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-07 19:39:01.000000000', 'message': 'Refresh the Service.service_id after re-spawning children

Currently, the oslo.service provider a mechanism that the main process
will re-spawn the children as necessary. But if we kill the children
service, the services (except the latest service) are always down
after re-spawn.

This reason of this problem is that the Service.service_id is inherited
from the parent process [1] (the parent Service service id class
attribute) and has been recorded as the last created service [2][3]
when latest process is stared. But when re-spawning child process,
only start() method would be called[1], so that the Service.service_id
is not refreshed as expected.

In order to refresh the Service class attribute service_id, we
should store the service_id in instance attr origin_service_id, and set
the class attr back using the instance attribute in start method.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/d987a4a/oslo_service/service.py#L648
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L193
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L344

Change-Id: Ibefda81215c5081634876a2064b15638388ae921
Closes-bug: #1811344
(cherry picked from commit 40127d95a9e83e97970dc388c18c99eea7715edc)
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh the Service.service_id after re-spawning children

Currently, the oslo.service provider a mechanism that the main process
will re-spawn the children as necessary. But if we kill the children
service, the services (except the latest service) are always down
after re-spawn.

This reason of this problem is that the Service.service_id is inherited
from the parent process [1] (the parent Service service id class
attribute) and has been recorded as the last created service [2][3]
when latest process is stared. But when re-spawning child process,
only start() method would be called[1], so that the Service.service_id
is not refreshed as expected.

In order to refresh the Service class attribute service_id, we
should store the service_id in instance attr origin_service_id, and set
the class attr back using the instance attribute in start method.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.service/blob/d987a4a/oslo_service/service.py#L648
[2] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L193
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/099b141/cinder/service.py#L344

Change-Id: Ibefda81215c5081634876a2064b15638388ae921
Closes-bug: #1811344
(cherry picked from commit 40127d95a9e83e97970dc388c18c99eea7715edc)

Looking at the generated PDF [1], "Team  and repository tags" has a separate chapter. It looks very odd.

[1] https://b212c65f7e122a9ab4a7-134fee3611f99557a1466ec5867d2d52.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/682343/7/check/openstack-tox-docs/bf02fbb/pdf/doc-designate-dashboard.pdf'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-10-17 08:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

> Looking at the generated PDF [1], "Team  and repository tags" has a
 > separate chapter. It looks very odd.
 > 
 > [1] https://b212c65f7e122a9ab4a7-134fee3611f99557a1466ec5867d2d52.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/682343/7/check/openstack-tox-docs/bf02fbb/pdf/doc-designate-dashboard.pdf

Could you suggest how to fix this?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-18 01:10:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Could you suggest how to fix this?

I don't have a specific suggestion.
It is totally up to the individual project team.
I am okay with any version if the you and designate team agree this is a good version to provide as the team deliverable."}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-10-18 08:26:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-10-18 08:57:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1

The documentation of this project could use some overhaul anyway, so I think this is good enough to satisfy the community goal. More fine tuning of the PDF generation can happen once/if anyone actually writes some helpful content.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-10-18 09:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> The documentation of this project could use some overhaul anyway,
 > so I think this is good enough to satisfy the community goal. More
 > fine tuning of the PDF generation can happen once/if anyone
 > actually writes some helpful content.

@frickler Thanks for the review. Should we need to backport this patch to stable/train?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-23 06:29:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> The documentation of this project could use some overhaul anyway, so I think this is good enough to satisfy the community goal. More fine tuning of the PDF generation can happen once/if anyone actually writes some helpful content.

Thanks for checking. I thought how to improve the contents a bit, but I gave it up soon as many contents are outdated and it will take time to check it. Currently most deployment projects handle deployments of the designate dashboard, so it looks not urgent.

It satisfies the minimum requirement of the community goal and there is ACK from the designate team. Let's merge it."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-23 06:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Should we need to backport this patch to stable/train?

As of now, stable/train backport is not necessarily required. The docs team plans to prepare some index page to collect PDF docs, but it does not happen yet. If any progress, assetle will announce it.'}]

commit_message:
Generate PDF documentation

This commit adds a new tox target to build PDF documentation.
It's a part of community goal, see storyboard for more
information.

Change-Id: I66add3b35283fdb6337b6dad9d79e852984d471f
Story: 2006078
Task: 34824

[{'created': '2019-10-16 19:17:02.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Change-Id: Ibbaf72e15c7bac269a3d4137e2c80c14772b237d

commit_message:
Post TC-election info-sheet

For this release, it came to our attention we don't
have a document detailing the little ins and outs after
joining the TC. This document, based on Doug Hellmann's
email in March 2019, details a few of the steps when a new
TC is elected, and edited based on latest CHAIR information.

Signed-Off By: Alexandra Settle <asettle@suse.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Co-Authored-By: Nate Johnston <nate.johnston@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7b4faba2f69badc14272daf5a8587c728d4d7f57

Loving this'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-16 12:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-16 13:23:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-09-16 13:40:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-09-17 02:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Tom, thanks so much for moving this forward! This is on a really good track.

If I'd known that anybody would take this up I'd have made more of an attempt to share more context - we got some feedback from the board that the old old help-most-wanted items weren't very persuasive and that we should focus more on business cases. But our first attempt to do that ended up focusing too much on how "we" (the OpenStack developer community) would benefit and not enough on how people putting up the money would benefit (to the point where some of the feedback was that the changes made it harder not easier to convince decisionmakers). Hence this new round of rewrites where we really want to try to put aside our perspective and focus on the business value in cash money.

Clearly you're already embracing the spirit of this exercise. My suggestions inline are basically that we should lean as hard in this direction as we can possibly imagine.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-09-23 11:23:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix missing environment variable in rabbitmq_init_bundle

After a template refactoring [2] we lost one environment variable
in HA container rabbitmq_init_bundle. Redeclare it to fix the issue.

[2] 81258ae551f84237fe9028edd2ac7d3fba28e14b

Change-Id: I139c2c276c8f532d37fceafe06f9547048e76906
(cherry picked from commit b18c1f554478d717a7f895d4784d4091d80b3d70)

[{'created': '2019-10-14 10:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'Update driver section.

Apart from FPGA and GPU, we support other device types
today and will add more in the future.

Most of the operations are common to the drivers we support.
For example, all drivers support device discovery, VM
creation/deletion, etc. None of them support firmware/shell
update today.

Also, we need to include the supported product families and
any special notes for the driver.

So this update removes the per-device-type files for FPGA
and GPU, and instead adds per-driver notes.

commit_message:
Update driver section.

Apart from FPGA and GPU, we support other device types
today and will add more in the future.

Most of the operations are common to the drivers we support.
For example, all drivers support device discovery, VM
creation/deletion, etc. None of them support firmware/shell
update today.

Also, we need to include the supported product families and
any special notes for the driver.

So this update removes the per-device-type files for FPGA
and GPU, and instead adds per-driver notes.

Change-Id: Id68f054bdf9167c34d03b56965b804529542efc5

(2 comments)

we should avoid using the user facing interfaces for this. If the user is already using ExtraConfigPre for something else, it would conflict with these resources (could only use one at a time).

i think you could also do this in a composable service with ansible tasks (host_prep_steps or similar).

have a look at extraconfig/pre_network/boot-params-service.yaml as an example'}, {'account_id': 22865, 'date': '2019-05-07 03:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 22865, 'date': '2019-05-07 03:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Derives NovaPCIPassthrough per SR-IOV node

This change is used to derive the pci_passthrough_whitelist parameters
automatically for all the SR-IOV nodes.

Change-Id: I3bd57d10580fc303201dc7516480ecf237bc98a5
Closes-Bug: #1841041

commit_message:
Fix positional formatting and add skip check

This patch fixes an offset positonal argument in a string format that
was throwing an IndexError exception. It also adds a skip check to check
if the required amphora SSH key file is readable.

Additionally, the iptables-based active-standby test has now a better
amphora_ssh_key default value to match with the default path set by the
Octavia Devstack plugin.

Story: 2006259
Task: 35876

Change-Id: Ic887c726dfe151ea582a1bd935ae0b30582f14ea

commit_message:
Connect collectd to QDR instead of Gnocchi

Usage of collectd with gnocchi has been deprecated, so there is more value
to test collectd/qdrouterd interaction and it should not be a default option
for deploy.

Change-Id: Icf2d9cd913fe58e0ea667a4be0f2bb06c41ad671

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-18 16:26:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issue moving hosts back to freepool

If an aggregate fails to be created for some reason, for example because
the requested node is not in the freepool, some cleanup occurs. Part of
the cleanup is ensuring the target node is moved _back_ to the freepool.
This should theoretically "heal" cases where the node wasn't in the
freepool but also wasn't in some lease aggregate.

However, this call to Nova's API refers to the freepool aggregate by its
name, which is not supported here: the ID must be used[1]. This caused
this operation to fail and raise a NotFound, confusingly (because Nova
couldn't find an aggregate with ID='freepool' for example.)

[1]:
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=add-host-detail#add-host

Closes-Bug: #1847821
Change-Id: I7af4d407b183578617131f0de42becb3dc2bc415
(cherry picked from commit 0346b02ccea75b992d0b72a6dbaa1f05864450e0)

commit_message:
Fix issue moving hosts back to freepool

If an aggregate fails to be created for some reason, for example because
the requested node is not in the freepool, some cleanup occurs. Part of
the cleanup is ensuring the target node is moved _back_ to the freepool.
This should theoretically "heal" cases where the node wasn't in the
freepool but also wasn't in some lease aggregate.

However, this call to Nova's API refers to the freepool aggregate by its
name, which is not supported here: the ID must be used[1]. This caused
this operation to fail and raise a NotFound, confusingly (because Nova
couldn't find an aggregate with ID='freepool' for example.)

[1]:
https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=add-host-detail#add-host

Closes-Bug: #1847821
Change-Id: I7af4d407b183578617131f0de42becb3dc2bc415
(cherry picked from commit 0346b02ccea75b992d0b72a6dbaa1f05864450e0)
(cherry picked from commit b30cece36ea143a97544799fb807644a51fd1c60)
